==Siri and the potential threat to Google's model==
+
==Reception==
[[Google]]âs executive chairman and former chief, [[Eric Schmidt]], has conceded that Siri could pose a "competitive threat" to the companyâs core search business.<ref>{{cite web|author=Eric Schmidt |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/eric-schmidt/8873664/Googles-Eric-Schmidt-Apples-Siri-could-pose-threat.html |title=Google's Eric Schmidt: Apple's Siri could pose 'threat' |publisher=Telegraph |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref> Google generates a large portion of its revenue from clickable ad links returned in the context of searches. The threat comes from the fact that Siri is a non-visual medium, therefore not affording users with the opportunity to be exposed to the clickable ad links.
[[Google]]âs executive chairman and former chief, [[Eric Schmidt]], has conceded that Siri could pose a "competitive threat" to the companyâs core search business.<ref>{{cite web|author=Eric Schmidt |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/eric-schmidt/8873664/Googles-Eric-Schmidt-Apples-Siri-could-pose-threat.html |title=Google's Eric Schmidt: Apple's Siri could pose 'threat' |publisher=Telegraph |date= |accessdate=2011-11-23}}</ref> Google generates a large portion of its revenue from clickable ad links returned in the context of searches. The threat comes from the fact that Siri is a non-visual medium, therefore not affording users with the opportunity to be exposed to the clickable ad links.
